service_identity: Data Lake & Business Intelligence is a service that helps organizations consolidate scattered data into scalable lakes and transform it into actionable intelligence. It offers centralized data lakes, real-time BI dashboards, self-service analytics, and data governance frameworks. This service is designed for organizations looking to unify their data sources and enhance decision-making capabilities.
service_capabilities: The service provides a scalable cloud backbone using Azure, AWS, and GCP, integrating various data sources into a unified data lake. It features real-time dashboards, role-based BI views, self-service analytics, and compliance with data governance standards. The service also supports automation-ready architecture and plug-and-play integrations with various platforms.
service_technologies: Technologies used include cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Data pipeline technologies like Kafka and Spark are utilized for live data streaming. Integration platforms support connections with SAP, Salesforce, and Stripe, among others.
service_intent: The service aims to reduce data management costs, enhance decision-making speed, and ensure compliance with data governance standards. It seeks to provide organizations with a trusted foundation for data-driven insights and operational efficiency. The ultimate goal is to empower businesses to make informed decisions based on real-time data.
service_problems: This service addresses the challenges of siloed data sources, which complicate decision-making and increase costs. It enables faster decision-making through real-time analytics and self-service capabilities. Additionally, it ensures compliance with regulations and provides role-based insights tailored to different organizational needs.
service_industries: The service is applicable in various industries including Banking & Finance, Insurance, Life Sciences, and Retail and FMCG. It is designed to meet the specific data needs of these sectors, enhancing their operational efficiency and decision-making processes.
service_usecases: Use cases include organizations consolidating their data into a single source of truth for better analytics and reporting. For example, Biocon achieved significant reductions in operational costs and faster reporting through the implementation of this service. Another use case involves businesses optimizing operations and customer engagement through advanced BI tools.
service_figures: The service has demonstrated a 24.6% average reduction in data management costs and a 27% average revenue increase for businesses utilizing BI. A case study with Biocon reported a 55% reduction in operational costs and a 28% faster reporting time. These metrics highlight the service's effectiveness in driving business outcomes.
